5.5. 
Persons who may be heirs
1. Heirs may be:
1) in the case of succession by operation of law, natural persons who were alive at the time of the deceased's death, the deceased's children born after the deceased's death, as well as the State of Lithuania;
2) in the case of succession by will, natural persons who were alive at the time of the death of the deceased, as well as those who were initiated during his/her lifetime and those who were born after his/her death; persons not yet initiated who were named in the will, after their birth;
(3) in the case of succession by will, legal persons existing at the time of the death of the deceased or created in pursuance of the will of the deceased as expressed in the will.
2. The State and municipalities may also be heirs under a will.
